body:
Comment 1: 
In regards to the 2.b. point, if people are using go (which is considered to be a new
programming language) and they want debugging support via gdb, I don't see a problem in
telling them: please use gdb x.y.z in order to be able to debug properly. And that's how
it should work imo, no need for forking gdb and such.

As for forking gdb, please consider that you can do a number of things with gdb like
remote debugging, IDE integration via gdb/mi which I'm sure are not going to be on top
of the priority list. It also means that those features will be denied to the users
using a 'new go debugger'.

And as a last thing, you can use gdb with binaries generated by bunch of other
programming language but if every programming language would roll its own debugger it
would be a messy situation imho.

I do however support adding to the docs that gdb support is currently not optimal.

Kind regards
